meanings.definition: Having a soft, loose, and sagging quality.
meanings.sent1: The old pillow felt flabbier after years of use.
meanings.sent2: As she gained weight, her arms became flabbier.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal looked flabbier than the real dog!
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were as flabbier than a wet noodle.
meanings.sent5: The cake was so moist and flabbier, it practically melted in my mouth.
